body:
Hello everyone! Here is my last video, I'm playing potion pvp and I think I'm becoming better, I've been a bit reekt but I finaly won, what do ou think?

title: Potions PVP \ / Getting better?

replies.body: You should practice your aim, also, I don't get how you can play on quake pro with speed 2 .-. Makes it so hard to aim, which is probably why your aim is a bit slow. Also practice strafing and comboing, refilling and hot keying is also important. :) nice video
replies.body_tagged: You should practice your aim, also, I don't get how you can play on quake pro with speed 2 .-. Makes it so hard to aim, which is probably why your aim is a bit slow. Also practice strafing and comboing, refilling and hot keying is also important. :) nice video

replies.body: I'm hotkeying :3 Thanks :) I think my aim is good but my opponent was better other guys :c I can't play when I'm not in quake pro, that's impossible for me :c Thanks :p
replies.body_tagged: I'm hotkeying :3 Thanks :) I think my aim is good but my opponent was better other guys :c I can't play when I'm not in quake pro, that's impossible for me :c Thanks :p

replies.body:
I always play on Quake Pro, except when I have speed.
No speed = Quake Pro
Speed I = 105 FOV
Speed II = 100 FOV

That might help with your aim :)

replies.body:
Here you go, my guide to Pot PvP

  • When you run into somebody, don't just stop there, keep sprinting around them, and even through them, to throw their aim off.
  • 90 FOV would probably be the best, I don't care what people say about aim, it works just fine for me.
  • Use a nice PvP edited faithful edit, I use Eum3's edit.
  • Be as aggressive as possible, keep combo'ing until you reach about 2 hearts, quickly turn away, throw 2 pots, turn around, keep combo'ing
  • Keep practicing, you will only improve.
If you want you can add me on Skype, we can do a few 1v1s, I wouldn't mind if you recorded either.

Nice debuffing by the way ;)

replies.body: Thanks for this guide :) I'm usually try harding (comboing with 0.5 hearts) and using my nice pack :p Thanks for the tips :p
